block.p: Pamela Ann Loman, a daughter of Diana and Thomas Loman of Harrington Park, N.J., is to be married today to Mark Raymond Homicz, the son of Sandra and Raymond Homicz of Palos Verdes, Calif. Rabbi Jerry Winston is to officiate at the Viansa Winery in Sonoma, Calif. David Loman, a Roman Catholic deacon and an uncle of the bride, is to take part in the ceremony.

The bride, 28, is keeping her name. She is the coordinator of a program at the Children's Hospital of Orange County in Orange, Calif., that helps children return to school after cancer treatment. She was also until recently a fellow in psychology at the hospital. She graduated magna cum laude from Tufts University and received an M.S. and a Master of Philosophy degree in psychology from Yale University. She expects to receive a Ph.D. in psychology from Yale later this month. Her father is a lawyer in Cresskill, N.J., and her mother manages his law office.

His mother is a mentor and resource specialist for teachers, based in San Pedro, in the adult education division of the Los Angeles Unified School District. His father retired as the assistant quality-control manager in the microelectronics division of the Hughes Aircraft Corporation in Torrance, Calif.
